rubrics.requirements: Core Firmware Architecture - The fundamental runtime system orchestrating keyboard operations and execution flow

sub_tasks.requirements: Main Execution Loop - The central process that orchestrates all keyboard operations
Continuously scans the key matrix for state changes
Processes detected key events through the feature pipeline
Manages system tasks and feature-specific periodic tasks
Generates and sends HID reports to the host computer
Key Event Processing Pipeline - Multi-stage transformation of raw matrix scans into host-consumable actions
Matrix Scanning - Detects physical key presses by scanning rows and columns
Supports standard diode matrices and direct pin configurations
Allows for custom matrix implementations
Debouncing - Filters out electrical noise from key switch contacts
Provides multiple debounce algorithms (symmetric, eager) for different hardware needs
Keycode Resolution - Maps matrix position to specific keycode based on active layer
Feature and Callback Hooks - Allows modular features to intercept and modify key events
Executes user-defined functions at various key processing stages
HID Report Generation - Translates processed keycodes into standard USB HID reports
Layer Management System - Stack-based system for managing multiple virtual keyboard layouts
Layer State Management - Dynamic layer activation with stack-based precedence
Transparency System - Key behavior inheritance allowing lower layers to show through
Layer Manipulation Functions - Momentary activation, toggling, and direct layer setting
Advanced layer features such as tri-layer states
State Management - Manages keyboard's internal state, both volatile and persistent
Runtime State Tracking - Manages modifier states, layers, and feature status
Persistent Storage Management - EEPROM/Flash storage for configuration settings
Implements wear-leveling for EEPROM emulation on flash memory
Real-Time Operating System Integration - ChibiOS RTOS integration for ARM-based MCUs
Hardware initialization and startup sequence management
Multitasking support for complex features like audio, RGB lighting, and USB communication
System timer and low-level hardware resource abstraction

LED Matrix drivers (IS31FL37xx series)
OLED/LCD screen drivers (SSD1306, HD44780)

Matrix layout, pin assignments, and feature definitions in structured format
